author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Dana White Fires Back at PFL’s Donn Davis: UFC’s Dominance Explained
text:
Dana White Fires Back at PFL’s Donn Davis: UFC’s Dominance Explained
Dana White has sharply criticized PFL CEO Donn Davis, asserting that the PFL should stop mentioning the UFC. Following recent claims from Davis about PFL outperforming the UFC in certain metrics, White fired back, presenting statistics comparing PFL to Power Slap. He described Davis' comments as nonsensical and suggested that he should focus on understanding MMA better. The escalating tensions hint at a growing rivalry as the PFL and UFC vie for recognition and market share in the mixed martial arts world.
By the Numbers- White claimed that the UFC Vegas 84 event outperformed PFL's significant performances.
- Davis admitted in an interview that he doesn't watch MMA outside of PFL, raising eyebrows among industry observers.
While White's accusations against PFL highlight a clear rivalry, some argue that competition can drive innovation and benefit fighters and fans alike. Bickering between organizations may also overshadow the actual growth of mixed martial arts as a sport.
State of Play- The rivalry comes after PFL's acquisition of Bellator, increasing media attention on both promotions.
- White has previously shown respect for PFL but has become more vocal and critical as their competition intensifies.
As both organizations continue to seek dominance in the MMA space, further confrontations are likely. The ongoing feud may provoke more aggressive marketing tactics and tougher matchups designed to elevate their brands.
Bottom LineThe escalating tensions between UFC and PFL exemplify how competitive dynamics in sports can lead to intense rivalries, but they also underscore the importance of maintaining respect while pursuing growth in the industry.
Read more at MMA Junkie

author: PA News Agency
title: Woman believed to be held hostage in Gaza declared dead | Watford Observer
text: A hard-hit Israeli kibbutz has announced the death of Judith Weinstein — an American-Canadian-Israeli woman who had been thought to be held hostage in Gaza. The news came six days after Ms Weinstein’s husband, Gad Haggai, was also declared dead. Ms Weinstein, 70, and Mr Haggai, 73, were taking an early morning walk near their home in Kibbutz Nir Oz on the morning of October 7 when Hamas militants burst across the border into Israel, killing about 1,200 people and kidnapping 240 others. In the early hours of the morning, Ms Weinstein was able to call emergency services and let them know that both she and her husband had been shot and send a message to her family. Ms Weinstein and her husband had been thought to be among the hostages still held in captivity in Gaza. But six days ago, the kibbutz announced that Mr Haggai was killed on October 7 and his body was taken to Gaza. On Thursday, the kibbutz said it had learned that Ms Weinstein was also killed on October 7 and her body is also being held in Gaza. It was not immediately clear how Israeli authorities determined their deaths. The couple are survived by two sons and two daughters and seven grandchildren, the kibbutz said. US President Joe Biden said he was “devastated” to learn of Ms Weinstein’s death, especially after hearing about the couple during a meeting with their daughter. The families “have been living through hell for weeks. No family should have to endure such an ordeal”, he said in a statement. Ms Weinstein was born in New York and was an active member of Kibbutz Nir Oz, a small community near the Gaza border where she taught English to children with special needs. The kibbutz said she also taught meditation techniques to children and teenagers who suffered from anxiety as a result of rocket fire from Gaza. Mr Haggai was a retired chef and jazz musician. “Judy dedicated her life to serving others, spending years teaching English and using her passions for poetry, puppeteering, and mindfulness to empower children of all backgrounds,” her family said in a statement. Al Haggai, one of the couple’s sons, told Israel’s Channel 13 that the family had originally hoped their mother’s multiple citizenships would allow her to be released during the week-long ceasefire in late November, when 105 hostages were let go. Almost all were women and children. He said that when his mother’s name was not on any of the daily lists, he started to suspect that something had happened to her. According to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office, at least 23 of the approximately 129 hostages believed to be held in Gaza have either died or been killed in captivity. Nir Oz was one of the hardest-hit Israeli communities on October 7, with roughly a quarter of its residents killed or kidnapped. The families of missing hostages have drawn widespread support and sympathy in Israel as they press the government to reach a new ceasefire deal to bring home their loved ones. Mr Netanyahu met on Thursday in Tel Aviv with some of the families, where he told them there were behind-the-scene efforts to bring the hostages home, according to a statement from his office. “I can’t elaborate on the details, we are working to return everyone,” he said. Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. author: (Redacción Interempresas)
title: Sener diseñará uno de los principales sistemas de la misión TRUTHS de la ESA, que mejorará la precisión de las mediciones climáticas desde el espacio
text:
TRUTHS es una de las iniciativas más relevantes de la década para la ESA, pues calibrará otras misiones y ayudará a combatir el cambio climático, mejorando la precisión de las mediciones de la radiación solar y de la Tierra
Sener diseñará uno de los principales sistemas de la misión TRUTHS de la ESA, que mejorará la precisión de las mediciones climáticas desde el espacio
El satélite de la misión incorporará un radiómetro solar absoluto criogénico y un espectrómetro de imágenes hiperespectrales, así como un novedoso sistema de calibración a bordo. Concretamente, Sener diseñará y prototipará el Sun Policromator (SPC), un elemento crítico y complejo que forma parte de dicho sistema de calibración a bordo.
De este modo, TRUTHS realizará mediciones continuas de la radiación solar y de la Tierra reflejadas para evaluar la relación de entrada y salida de energía de la Tierra. Funcionará como un “laboratorio de metrología en el espacio” que ayudará a establecer un estándar de referencia para mediciones climáticas y detectar cambios en el sistema climático de la Tierra, y que también servirá como referencia de calibración cruzada para otros satélites y sensores.
Se estima que el lanzamiento de la misión tenga lugar en 2030, creando un observatorio de clima y calibración en el espacio que reducirá la incertidumbre en los datos de observación de la Tierra y establecerá un nuevo punto de referencia para detectar cambios en el sistema climático del planeta. TRUTHS generará mayor confiabilidad en la información empleada en la acción climática, proporcionando datos climáticos de referencia fiables, trazables respecto al Sistema Internacional de Unidades.
ESA. Autor: Airbus.

author: 汪浩
title: 脑机接口打开"星孩"康复新视界
text:
首页/ 城市/ 新政/ 经济/ 社会/ 文化/ 体育+/ 科教卫
杭州日报讯 当教育赋能的星火渐成燎原之势，滨江的科技基因正为这场对孤独症孩子的特殊关爱注入新动能。
昨日，在滨江区残疾人综合服务中心脑机接口康复训练室内，15岁的小谢头戴专业设备正专注地进行认知训练，随着8盏指示灯渐次亮起，实时脑电波图谱在屏幕上跃动……这项由滨江残联全额支持的公益项目“点亮星星行动”，已让32个家庭见证改变。
“就像给大脑修建信息高速公路。”训练师王艺佼解释道，“与传统康复不同，这项技术直击神经连接底层问题，通过反复训练重建脑功能区连接。”目前该区布局的三个训练点，让更多孤独症儿童家庭得以就近接受每周3—5次、每次35—40分钟的精准干预。
接受训练的儿童家长纷纷反馈惊喜变化。“他的语言表达比以前有明显提高！”第一次带孩子参加脑机接口康复训练的董妈妈说，家人因为天天在一起，容易猜出孩子想表达的意思，但陌生人就很难听懂。经过训练，孩子基本能表达出自己想要表达的内容，“原本高昂的训练费让我们心有余而力不足，免费康复犹如及时雨！”
14岁的楠楠此前接受过脑机接口康复训练，因为疗效好，家人为其报名了该项目。“有两大改变，一是情绪和语言表达好了许多；二是变得有耐心了，以前上厕所不会排队，现在她学会了等候。”楠楠的奶奶认为，一对一的训练，也给孩子多了社交锻炼机会。
从政企联动的暑托班升级、到科技赋能的脑功能训练，滨江区构建的立体化支持体系，展现了对特殊群体关怀的深意。未来，该区将持续扩大康复服务覆盖面，让更多特殊儿童在包容与创新中绽放生命光彩。

author: Juan Bautista Salaverri
title: VIDEO: los fuertes abucheos de los hinchas franceses a Los Pumas 7s en los Juegos Olímpicos | Radio Mitre
text: [Los Pumas 7s](https://radiomitre.cienradios.com/deportes/el-mal-momento-que-vivieron-los-pumas-en-la-villa-olimpica-antes-del-debut-en-paris-un-desastre/) se clasificaron ayer por la tarde a los cuartos de final de los [Juegos Olímpicos](https://radiomitre.cienradios.com/radio-francia-internacional/deportes/todas-la-ciudades-donde-se-disputaran-los-juegos-olimpicos-2024/), tras vencer a Samoa. Sin embargo, previo a los dos partidos por fase de grupos, el público francés que estaba en el Stade de France abucheó completamente el himno argentino. Así mismo, en el resto de los partidos silbaban cada avance y try del conjunto nacional. La FIFA abrió una investigación tras el escándalo entre Argentina y Marruecos en los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024 Franceses volvieron a abuchear el himno de Argentina en el partido de Los Pumas 7s Con más de 81 mil personas en el estadio, la imagen se volvió a repetir y los locales repudiaron al conjunto argentino cunado sonó el himno nacional. El seleccionado nacional, de buen presente en el circuito, disputó la última fecha del grupo ante Australia, ambos ya clasificados. Sin embargo, fue derrota por 14 a 22 y quedó relegado al segundo puesto. Producto de esta posición, el rival fue Francia, quien se quedó con su grupo. Por lo tanto, se trataba de un partido con un condimento especial, ya que se jugaba contra el local, con todo el público en contra y en medio de las polémicas que generó el canto de Enzo Fernández y los jugadores de la Selección Argentina. En este sentido, cuando se volvieron a escuchar las estrofas del Himno Nacional Argentino, los locales demostraron su descontento. Se supo todo lo que le robaron a Thiago Almada en los Juegos Olímpicos y la abultada cifra causó conmoción Los Pumas 7s perdieron ante Francia y quedaron eliminados de los Juegos Olímpicos de París Desafortunadamente, Los Pumas 7s perdieron ante Francia y se despidieron de los Juegos Olímpicos. Fue derrota por 26 a 14 y no pudieron avanzar a las semifinales en busca de otra medalla (ya habían ganado en Tokyo 2020). El primero tiempo fue catastrófico para el seleccionado nacional, que se fue al entretiempo perdiendo por 21 a 0. Sin embargo, el segundo tiempo fue distinto y se puso a tan solo 7 puntos, aunque un error sentenció el partido.

author: Steve Symington
title: Why JD.com Stock Jumped Today
text:
Shares of JD.com ( JD 2.74% ) jumped as much as 5.2% early Thursday then settled to trade up 2.8% as of 3:45 p.m. ET after the Chinese e-commerce giant revealed it's planning sweeping raises for its front-line staff next year.
In a post to its official WeChat account this morning, JD.com said it will nearly double the fixed salaries for its procurement, sales, and other front-line staff beginning Jan. 1, 2024. JD.com also said its retail staff will receive 20%+ pay increases.
A vote of confidence from JD.com The market appears to be taking this development as an encouraging vote of confidence in JD.com's growth trajectory. JD.com has struggled to drive top-line growth in recent quarters -- with revenue last quarter rising a modest 1.7% year over year -- amid fierce competition and macroeconomic uncertainty that has dampened consumer spending in China.
At the same time, however, JD.com shares surged earlier this month after the Chinese government initiated new stimulus measures designed to stimulate the country's economic growth and bolster its struggling property sector. If these significant pay raises are any indication, perhaps JD.com is already seeing some of the early positive impact of those stimulus measures.
What's next for JD.com investors? JD.com should be slated to release its fourth-quarter and full-year 2023 results in early March. On the former, most analysts are modeling an accelerated 6.2% increase in quarterly revenue, which would mean a slight (0.2%) decline in revenue for all of 2023.
Most analysts will be more focused, however, on any clarity JD.com management can give investors with regard to growth in the coming year. With consensus estimates on Wall Street calling for a return to top-line growth of 6.8% for 2024, any incremental optimism would be well received by shareholders looking for JD.com's growth headwinds to abate.
